sentence: Shares of Beacon Roofing Supply, Inc .
BECN have gained 12% since it reported record fourth-quarter fiscal 2015 (ended Sep 30, 2015) earnings of 75 cents on Nov 24.
The company's earnings increased 56% year over year and beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 69 cents, recording a positive earnings surprise of 9%.

Higher volume and gross margins, partially offset by increased operating expenses due to the incremental costs associated with the acquisitions undertaken and the 32 greenfields opened in the last 24 months, led to the overall improvement.
The distributor of residential and non-residential roofing materials posted record fourth-quarter sales as well, which totaled $788 million, up 8% year over year.
Sales, however, failed to match the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $789 million.
The year-over-year sales increase was led by growth in all product lines of the company.
Residential product sales increased 11.4% while non-residential roofing product sales inched up 1%.
Complementary product sales rose 17.8%.
Existing market sales (excluding acquisitions) were up 4.1%.
Cost of goods sold went up 6% year over year to $596 million.
Gross profit was $191 million, up from $163 million in the year-ago quarter.
Gross margin expanded 180 basis points (bps) year over year to 24.3%.

Operating expenses for the quarter increased 10% year over year to $132 million owing to the incremental costs associated with the three acquisitions made this year and the 32 greenfields opened over the last 24 months.
The company posted operating income of $59 million compared with $43 million in the prior-year quarter.
Operating margin expanded 160 basis points to 7.5% in the reported quarter.
Beacon Roofing reported adjusted earnings per share of $1.38 in fiscal 2015, up 28% from $1.08 in fiscal 2014 and ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.32.
Including one time items, earnings per share were $1.24 compared with $1.08 in the prior fiscal.
Fiscal 2015 sales increased 8% year over year to a record $2,515 million, but failed to match the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $2,517 million.
Beacon Roofing reported cash and cash equivalents of $45.7 million at the end of fiscal 2015 compared with $54.5 million at fiscal 2014-end.
The decrease in cash was due to higher expenses associated with acquisition activities in 2015.

Through positive working capital management and higher net income, Beacon Roofing funded three acquisitions and managed to improve its leverage ratio to 2.18 from 2.37 at the end of the fourth quarter of fiscal 2014.
The company generated $109 million in cash from operating activities for fiscal 2015 compared with cash usage of $55.5 million in the last fiscal.
The increase in operating cash flow was primarily owing to changes in working capital and higher net income in the current year.
Long-term debt was $197 million as of Sep 30, 2015, compared with $216 million as of Sep 30, 2014.

On Oct 1, 2015, Beacon Roofing successfully completed its previously announced acquisition of Roofing Supply Group, a leading roofing products distributor, in a cash and stock transaction valued at approximately $1.1 billion.

The buyout will strengthen Beacon Roofing's position as the largest publicly traded roofing materials and related products distributor in the U.S., with approximately $3.6 billion in pro forma revenues.

Beacon Roofing now has a significantly expanded geographic footprint that includes 359 locations across 45 states, with enhanced presence in the Southern and Western United States and the Pacific Northwest.
In fiscal 2016, Beacon Roofing plans to retain its focus on organic growth as well as on additional greenfields and acquisitions.
The company projects revenues in the range of $3.8 billion to $4 billion for fiscal 2016.
It estimates gross margins in the range of 23% to 24% and earnings per share of around $1.80.

Peabody, MA-based Beacon Roofing is one of the major distributors of residential and non-residential roofing materials as well as complementary building products in the U.S. and Canada, with more than 90% of its sales coming from the U.S.

Beacon Roofing currently has a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).
Some better-ranked stocks in the sector are Regis Corp. RGS , The Home Depot, Inc. HD , Tile Shop Holdings, Inc. TTS .
While Regis sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), Home Depot and Tile Shop Holdings carry a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
